ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Renal Cell Carcinoma Treatment Study Additional Surgical Procedure

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Renal Cell Carcinoma Treatment Study Additional Surgical Procedure
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The most common type of kidney cancer. It begins in the lining of the renal tubules in the kidney. The renal tubules filter the blood and produce urine.: A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.: Any surgical procedure performed subsequent to a primary or initial surgical procedure.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma arising from the renal parenchyma.  There is a strong correlation between cigarette smoking and the development of renal cell carcinoma.  The clinical presentation includes : hematuria, flank pain and a palpable lumbar mass.  A high percentage of renal cell carcinomas are diagnosed when an ultrasound is performed for other purposes.  Radical nephrectomy is the standard intervention procedure.  Renal cell carcinoma is generally considered to be resistant to radiation treatment and chemotherapy.
A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.
Any surgical procedure performed subsequent to a primary or initial surgical procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.: Of or pertaining to the kidney.: A tumor at the original site of origin.: A type of study protocol designed to evaluate intervention(s) for disease treatment.: Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time; the state of being slower or later.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.: The most common type of kidney cancer. It begins in the lining of the renal tubules in the kidney. The renal tubules filter the blood and produce urine.: Characteristic or indicative of a condition.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.

A carcinoma arising from the renal parenchyma.  There is a strong correlation between cigarette smoking and the development of renal cell carcinoma.  The clinical presentation includes : hematuria, flank pain and a palpable lumbar mass.  A high percentage of renal cell carcinomas are diagnosed when an ultrasound is performed for other purposes.  Radical nephrectomy is the standard intervention procedure.  Renal cell carcinoma is generally considered to be resistant to radiation treatment and chemotherapy.
Characteristic or indicative of a condition.
